alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyridine ring, which bears a ketone.
alternative_parents.name: Pyridinones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a pyridine ring substituted at one or more positions by a methyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Methylpyridines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a pyridine ring substituted at one or more positions by a hydroxyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Hydroxypyridines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a dihydropyridine moiety, which is a semi-saturated pyridine derivative with two double bonds.
alternative_parents.name: Dihydropyridines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyridinium ring, which is the cationic form of pyridine.
alternative_parents.name: Pyridinium derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a trialkylamine group, characterized by exactly three alkyl groups bonded to the amino nitrogen.
alternative_parents.name: Trialkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a lactam ring, which is a cyclic amide of amino carboxylic acids, having a 1-azacycloalkan-2-one structure (or an analogue having unsaturation or heteroatoms replacing one or more carbon atoms of the ring).
alternative_parents.name: Lactams

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of diazene(diimide), HN=NH, wherein both hydrogens are substituted by hydrocarbyl groups, e.g. PhN=NPh azobenzene or diphenyldiazene.
alternative_parents.name: Azo compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure  X#N+-Z- <-> X-=N+=Z <-> X-=N-Z+ <-> X-N=Z (X = C or O, Z = C, N, or O).
alternative_parents.name: Propargyl-type 1,3-dipolar organic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and an oxygen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organooxygen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a chlorine ion.
alternative_parents.name: Organic chloride salts

alternative_parents.description: Organic salts that results from the reaction of hydrochloric acid with an organic base.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Aromatic compounds containing one monocyclic ring system consisting of benzene.
class.name: Benzene and substituted derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as diphenylmethanes. These are compounds containing a diphenylmethane moiety, which consists of a methane wherein two hydrogen atoms are replaced by two phenyl groups.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing a diphenylmethane moiety, which consists of a methane wherein two hydrogen atoms are replaced by two phenyl groups.
direct_parent.name: Diphenylmethanes

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds containing a diphenylmethane moiety, which consists of a methane wherein two hydrogen atoms are replaced by two phenyl groups.
subclass.name: Diphenylmethanes

superclass.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
superclass.name: Benzenoids
